Reviews.Title: “Good location - very basic”
Reviews.Author: farrahmu
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel only because it was the only one left in the area. It's very basic - no frills. Staff were OK - rooms were clinically clean. No hot water in my shower, mildly warm and absolutely no pressure. You need 4 keys just to get from the street to your room which was annoying. Paper thin walls - I thought the people in the next room were IN my room. Lots of slamming doors in the morning. Didn't have breakfast - didn't look overly appetising - and why would you when you have Campo de Fiori, Piazza Navona etc all around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but not very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Pantsy
Reviews.Content: This is a very small hotel on a busy street, breakfast was less than desirable. We tried to check out early, but the girl working the front desk didn't know how to work the credit card machine! We came back when she told us, and no one was working the front desk, for hours!! The rooms are sparse with no tv or sheets (they just give you a thin duvet-type thing). I will say that it was clean, but the price seemed rather high for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “very good location terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mpr1971
Reviews.Content: The location it's very good, the hotel very clean even if modest, we got lucky and got probably the only room with a tv set and small fridge, but no phone!! and the breakfast was the most poor and cheap breakfast I never got in any hotel with the worst coffee ever in Italy! A real pity because for the price and the location the place is worth to pay and the staff are all kind beside one short and rude girl that doesn't speak a word of English. I will suggest the owner, please do not serve your cheap breakfast!! so you will not upset your guest!

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable, overbooked so had to move hotels”
Reviews.Author: Hkj00
Reviews.Content: Very unimpressed with this hotel. I booked one night here for my sister and her new husband who flew in from Germany that day. We went to the hotel at 9 am and staff said the room wasn't ready (understandable as check in was 2pm I think). We went back at 2pm and staff said there were no rooms and they had overbooked. They used the excuse that rooms were damaged from rain the previous day (which was true, there were storms). But why we couldn't have been told at 9am? we could have found another hotel. Instead, my sister and husband had to walk 10 minutes to another hotel. Didn't even offer to help with their bags. Very unimpressed with the service of this hotel. I only booked this hotel as it was close to where I was staying. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable beds, air conditioning and hot water problems”
Reviews.Author: DannyE44
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and were pretty satisfied. The hotel provided what was advertised - great location, clean rooms, kosher friendly/vegetarian breakfast, no TV, no phone, part time front desk staff at a price well below other hotels and accomodations in the area. We walked everywhere - to the Jewish Ghetto and synagogue, to the Vatican, to major sites like Trevi Fountain, Forum, piazzas and monuments and an internet center just down the street. We arrived from the airport early in the morning a few hours before check-in time. The staff was very accomodating. We were able to get our keys, put our luggage in our room even though it was not ready yet and use the washrooms which was a huge help. That night, the airconditioning worked just fine...until about 1 AM when the compressor seemed to go off (and went back on at about 5 AM) - It got quite hot in the room and hard to sleep. Opening the windows was no solution because of the noise from the main street. And then...in the mornng there was no hot water to shower! We spoke to the helpful front desk clerk who explained that there was a hot water problem that was being fixed and that indeed the compressor does go off (saving money? neighbor complaints about noise? Not clear). In any event they arranged for us to get a fan and the hot water did get fixed so our 2 and 3rd night was much better,

Reviews.Title: “Superb location for sightseeing, super clean and comfy rooms. Not gluten-free friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Bibipatata
Reviews.Content: The location is superb - 10 minutes from Piazza Navona, 15 minutes from the Pantheon, 20 minutes from Fori Imperiali and about 30 minutes from the Colosseum on foot. And from Saint Peter's Square about 20/25 minutes on foot. We bought a open bus pass for the weekend but realised we could have easily done the tour of Rome on foot thanks to the location of the B&B. The room was lovely, spotless and with air con. The bathroom was new and spotless. I was impressed with the standard of cleaning. I found it great value considering the location. In my opinion the only negative was the breakfast which I found of poor quality and with no gluten free option - Having said that, there is a lovely bar nearby (Gerry's bar) where they offer lovely cappuccinos and great pastrys.

Reviews.Title: “Small basic rooms, paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: nhoigal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. You can hear a pin drop in the next room... we had a problem with the hot water ( and got a discount)

Reviews.Title: “not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: 49alina
Reviews.Content: The hotel has huge price for rooms compared to services offered even though location is great and staff really kind and helpful. Breakfast - low quality, rooms with thin walls (one could hear every wisper in the next room, you would get up in the morning whenever the staff started setting the breakfast room), TV set occasionally not functional (some cable problems I presumed), and the worse was that there was no hot water for three days out of five; with the canicular weather in Rome and our daily schedule (walks through the city all day long) you can imagine the confort when coming back to our room in the evening. One can accept these problems may arise anywhere the issue was that no action was taken for days in a row, which is unacceptable. Our vacation was ruined. Would never recommend this hotel nor will I trust booking.com

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Oscar1954
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel. it has no lobby to rest, but locates in a perfect location in Roma. the rooms are good with WC and shower included, airconditioned (but the A/C in our room didn't work well).

Reviews.Title: “We had a very bad time in Migdal Palace”
Reviews.Author: Gideon2011
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay, but left after one night ! After recently traveling in the USA and all across Europe, we visited many hotels, but Migdal "Palace" was absolutely the worst one ever. As my wife is pregnant, I pre-arranged for the hotel transportation taxi to pick us up from the airport, but the driver didn't show up (this made us waste approx. 3 hours while waiting in vain). After taking the train and a taxi, we reached Migdal Palace, but didn't really get any apology for the incident. The man at the desk simply didn't care. Unfurtunately, this was only the preview of our stay... We found out that the hotel actually looks more like a hospital or a monastery. It's not about "basic" (we like basic) - it's about "depressing"... Our room had NO telephone, no safe, no pictures on the wall, no shampoo, no air-condition remote control, no fridge or mini-bar... All it did have was an old bed, and a TV set. Simply a joke. Some of the light-bulbs in the room were burned out, it was really bad. The room we got was right next to the front desk (one meter away), and facing the busy street... We didn't sleep at all during the night, as the traffic noise was very strong. The people at the desk gave us a set of 4 keys (!), all of which are a must - there is the room key, there is the hotel floor key, and there are 2 keys for the front doors of the building. Come on... Very uncomfortable to say the least. One night was enough for us to decide we can't stay any longer. Breakfast was dull, and during the morning hours, drilling noises started from an upper floor (as the hotel is located inside an apartment building). We had no trouble finding a different two-star hotel, within five walking minutes away, in a price that was 25% less expensive. And guess what? Our new room had a phone, a safe, shampoo, etc. etc. Bottom line - I wouldn't recomment this hotel at all. Shame on them.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional staff - a truly marvelous location!”
Reviews.Author: Shmuelh
Reviews.Content: We found that staying at the Migdal Palace put most of the tourism venues in easy walking distance. This included, among others, the Coloseum, Forum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, and the Vatican. You are also a few minutes from Piazza Navona. The staff - especially Domenico - were all extremely helpful and knowledgeable. For Kashrut observers, especially, the morning kosher breakfast is a great convenience. We stayed at the hotel during a few really hot days, but as all the rooms are fully air-conditioned 24 hours a day, that was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “great location for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: rafiost
Reviews.Content: we chose the hotel for the centrality and proximity to the great synagogue of rome. also one minute walk from piazza navona and 20 minutes to vatican city. kosher breakfast. clean rooms. aircondition which worked very well in 2 rooms out of 3. pleasant and helpful staff. we fully reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable - excellent room & shower- ex. location”
Reviews.Author: tzfoni
Reviews.Content: the hotel is actually about 13 rooms in a whole old fashion building. a reception, and breakfast room. the location is great - 5-15 minutes from every interesting spot in rome. close to the old ghetto where are many kosher restaurants- if you eat kosher. breakfast simple but good and kosher. the only problem was noise from the street.but we got used to it. the room was big enough, new, and shower very big,clean, and new - better than even 5 star hotels in israel. there was a small leak from the shower- we asked in the mornning and when we came back it was already fixed. the girl in the reception also gave us good advice about restaurants in the neighborhood. i reccomend - especially to people that want kosher food. and those who look for central place and nice clean room and polite staff members.

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice hotel, great location. feels like home”
Reviews.Author: IsraeliPetachTikva
Reviews.Content: A great place, excellent location. every thing is clean & arranged, good breakfast, comfortable beds. Close to every important site in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative for central and not expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: TlvTamy
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my mother and we really recommend this hotel. The hotel is verry central, located on Via Vittorio Emanulle, two min. walk from piazza navona and Campo De Fiori. the hotel is actually at the 1 floor of a building and very small (13 rooms) and really nice and warm. the staff is verry nice, the rooms are small but nice with a parquet floor, toilets and bath looks brand new, and the beds are comfortable and there is a lot of place for storage. the breakfast was very simple but still fine in conclusion the hotel is for someone who really cars to stay at the center of Rome and has no need at the hotel facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and simple. perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Oscar1954
Reviews.Content: we have spent 5 nights at Migdal Palace hotel in Rome. the room was clean. the stuff very nice and helpful. the location is perfect ! the day we left they let us stay more hours till afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: stesler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on holiday to Rome and stayed at the Migdal Palace for 4 nights. With 13 total rooms it is no frills hotel but we did not miss them. The room was just the right size, clean and maintained beautifully. The staff was helpful and accomodating in every way. The location could not have been better - we did not step on to a bus the whole time we were in Rome and did not need to either. The only downside was the noise from the street which we could hear even at the back of the hotel. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Kosher breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: yeho
Reviews.Content: Clean room. Bathroom. Nice kosher breakfast. Great location. Warm stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great to be in migdal palace - New, Clean, good breakfast, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Anat_m
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed very much this hotel, it is a place you can see the great investment and thought they did to make you feel good. The shower is wide, the vent in toilet you dont hear, the decoration of the room is in a very good taste. the breakfast very generous - vegetables, egges, fruit esc. The are located 1 min from Pizza Navona, in the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: shlik
Reviews.Content: The hotel is positioned in the very center of old Rome, and in a walking distance to all the major attractions (colloseum, forum, Vatican, all the piazzas, etc.). The room is very simple, we had to single beds. it is better to ask a room that does not face the main street (Vittorio Emanuel 2). During our stay we recieved a pretty simple breakfast but we always ate outside (starting the morning in campo di fiori market). The room is very nice and clean, wooden-like floors, IKEA decor, but most important - AIR-CONDITION!!! The staff is lovely - we had a flight at 23:00 and they let us stay in the room as long as we wanted without asking extra money. bottom line: great base-station to explore Rome. very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, terrible hotel with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: terpy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in July. Our experience there was terrible and we will never, ever go there again. The place advertises air conditioning, but THEY SHUT IT OFF AT 10:30 PM. Our room was unbearable at night. The air was working decently until nightime, when we noticed it getting warmer. We sweated through the first night and complained the next morning. The staff barely knows English, so we had communication problems. They promised us to get the AC fixed, and to get us fans for the room. We were told that evening everything was fine, but surprise, surprise, no AC again. They actually told us the reason: at night they have an automatic switch that turns off the AC compressors. It was so hot and miserable in that hotel. Then to make matters worse when we checked out, we expected a reduced or free stay. Nope. They wanted to charge us full rate for both nights. This after they admitted they turned off the AC on purpose, but told us we'd have AC. We refused to pay, so they said they'd report us to Immigration and we couldn't leave the country. We kept arguing, and then they threatened to call the police and have us arrested. We finally agreed to pay 75% of the full rate for both nights, and they weren't happy about that rate so they told us "Get your things, get out of here in 10 minutes and we never see you again". So we got kicked out of the hotel. The place is the most rude, inconsiderate, and miserably hot hotel I've ever been to. Please, consider any other place in Rome before this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great new Hotel, nice staff and near many major sites.”
Reviews.Author: Faune
Reviews.Content: The hotel was new and very clean. They had Air conditioning (which is rare in Italy.) If you plan to go to Italy in the summer A/C is a must! The owner was very nice. The staff was also very friendly and willing to help, the guy at the desk sat with me for 15 minuets to help me find sites on the map and explain how to get to them on foot, by bus and/or by tram (he even made copies of the map for us). The hotel gives you the keys so you can come and go as you please even if the person at the desk is not there to buzz you in to the building. The breakfast was decent it consisted of milk, coffee, juice, cereal, rolls, cake, croissants, eggs, cheeses, butter, jelly, cucumbers and tomatoes. (The breakfast is Kosher to whom it may concern) They take credit cards. Overall it was a very pleasant experience and we strongly recommend Migdal Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Pension in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Israli_in_USA
Reviews.Content: Got this Hotel recommendation from a travel agent in Israel. This small pension size hotel is on the first floor of a large apartment building. They give you all the keys to get in so you can come and go as you please. Decent sized rooms with bath. Everything new. Just opened. They cater to the Kosher crowd but anyone can book. Just no meat for breakfast or hot coffee on Saturday morning. Otherwise it was a great choice. Walk to Piazza Navona and lots of other sites. Near the old Jewish Quarter. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in the center and is not looking for a large name brand hotel. The owner, Giorgio, is a sweetheart. The staff at the desk were most helpful. You really feel like your in Rome if you stay here. Website is --- email is --- Tel: --- Fax: ---

HotelInfo.Name: Migdal Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Corso Vittorio Emanuele II n. 173, 00186 Rome, Italy
